operation.descriptionCdata:
dd832fdb-2bef-4fe8-8cc2-e6723a5ddd9e.117cb240-597c-406c-8192-ee776621ae04.prompt=HostName\: dd832fdb-2bef-4fe8-8cc2-e6723a5ddd9e.31963bf6-6350-435e-a6be-53248af5e98c.prompt=Column delimiter\: dd832fdb-2bef-4fe8-8cc2-e6723a5ddd9e.description=
Gets the available information about clustered resources. The operation returns a table with the resources, specifying the following information for each resource\: Name, State, Owner, Group and ResourceType.

Input Parameters\:
host - the hostname or ip address of the cluster server.
rowDelimiter - the delimiter for the rows. Defaults to newLine.
colDelimiter - the delimiter for the columns in the returned result.Defaults to ','.

Results\:
returnResult - a table contaning information about the cluster resources. The columns of the table are\: Name, State, Owner, Group and ResourceType. The table has one input for each resource. The columns are delimited by colDelimiter, the rows are delimited by rowDelimiter.

Responses\:
failure - no available resources or something went wrong.
success - the information about resources was retrieved successfully.

Notes\:
1. Thanks to MS's way of building the COM interface to MS Clustering admin tools, we can't use any impersonation with it.  
Therefore, to make it work properly you have to run the Windows RAS service as an account with privileges.
2. Clean install of Windows 2008 (on the RAS machine) does not include by default msclus.dll library. To work around this issue there are 2 alternatives. The first one is to install the failover clustering feature on the machine, which will install the msclus.dll to "%systemroot%\system32\msclus.dll". The alternative is to  copy "%systemroot%\system32\msclus.dll" from a Windows Server 2003 server to the same location on the Windows 2008 (R2) machine and run "regsvr32 %systemroot%\system32\msclus.dll" (if you have a 64-bit Windows 2008 then you have to copy msclus.dll from a 64-bit Windows 2003).
3. To administer a Windows 2008 cluster you have to install RAS on a Windows 2008 machine. Backward compatibility has been broken by Microsoft, according to http\://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb756975.aspx, which means that you cannot call Cluster APIs from a Windows Server 2008 Cluster to a down-level cluster (Windows NT 4.0, Windows 2000, or Windows 2003). Also, you cannot be on a down-level client and remotely call Cluster APIs against a Windows Server 2008 node.
dd832fdb-2bef-4fe8-8cc2-e6723a5ddd9e.f7bd45cf-25c5-4436-b329-1092cbf16fa8.prompt=Row delimiter\:
operation.name: Get Clustered Resources
